explanations.machine learning: The paper uses machine learning techniques such as support vector machine (SVM) and modified particle swarm optimization algorithm (MPSO) for predicting firm default risk.
explanations.supervised learning: The SVM model used in the paper is a supervised learning algorithm, as it requires labeled data for training to predict firm default risk.
explanations.classification: The SVM model is used for classification tasks, specifically to predict whether a firm will default or not.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper explicitly mentions the use of SVM as part of its three-stage prediction model for firm default risk.
explanations.SVM: This is the abbreviation for support vector machine, which is a key component of the proposed prediction model.
explanations.feature learning: The paper discusses feature selection using association rule algorithm (ARA) to reduce the dimensions of both financial and non-financial variables, which is a part of feature learning.
